reviews.review_msg: Professor Day's class is nearly impossible to get a good mark in. All assessments have had a average of 50%-60%. He assigns around 2-3 chapters per unit exam and finds the smallest details to put on them. If you want a good mark in this class you need to put at least 2-3 hours a day into studying for it

In the fall and spring terms of 2022 Dr. Day did his class as a flipped course, meaning the lectures were online for you to watch on your own and then you came to class for assessments and question . He has received comments like this " He never taught anything in lectures, just made us read the textbook" are from students who didn't listen.

Dr. Day had short 30 minute lectures online, which were non-mandatory, but he gave previews about what we would be learning. Tests and quizzes were fair as long as you take time to read the textbook. We had open-book assessments, and he removed a test and two quizzes if you did poorly! But he definitely has a higher grading scale.

He is a great professor. If you go to class and do the work, ask questions in office hours, you're golden. He was so genuinely caring and kind and explained things really well when I went to office hours. If you put in the work and show up to class, you will do well. He is really great at explaining concepts and an overall great teacher/human.

PSYC102 He is a very interesting professor, he really tries to engage his audience. He uses a lot of questions from the textbook, so as long as you study the textbook, you wont really need to attend lectures, but I recommend going for clarification.

His lecture is useless you can find everything on textbook and his quiz and midterm are all about so details. The average I believe last semester was C cause he even changed the scale after the last exam.

Russell Day is a pretty good teacher. He is passionate about the material and his class was really interesting. There were 4 exams total which is kind of a lot but if you read the textbook chapters you will do well. The essay questions on the exams were really difficult so make sure you have an amazing ability to comprehend and apply material.

There isn't a lot of clear guidelines to what is expected for the essay questions on the midterms. Went to his office hour and he makes you feel like you should't be asking questions if you are able to find the definitions in the textbook. He comes off as rude and arrogant.
he needs a lot of details for the essay answers

He is super entertaining and keeps lecture interesting. You can be successful in this class without attending lectures, except those where clicker quizzes or tests fall on. Make sure you read the text because lots of quiz content and test content correlate with chapter readings. Makes psych really interesting
Straight forward. His lectures are interesting and relevant to psychology, but not always relevant to what we're studying particularly. Often goes on tangents.

Amazing Prof, clear, easy to understand, passionate, didn't put me to sleep. Tough class though, mc questions are mostly situational and applying what you learned. Short answers were the toughest part.

Nice Prof, you definitely need to read the text; lecture is kind of helpful. Essays questions are hard, but if you study hard you will get what you expected. Overall very fair marking and exams, recommended.

I love this prof! Funny, easy going and very clear. If only the classes weren't so huge! His TAs, watchout, they don't mark very well. The written part of the exams, you should ask him in person on how he wants it done, it took me while to figure outhe was looking for (its not always about what you know).
